metadata.title: CVE-2019-11479 on Ubuntu Pro FIPS 18.04 LTS (bionic) - medium
metadata.description:
Jonathan Looney discovered that the Linux kernel default MSS is hard-codedto 48 bytes. This allows a remote peer to fragment TCP resend queuessignificantly more than if a larger MSS were enforced. A remote attackercould use this to cause a denial of service. This has been fixed in stablekernel releases 4.4.182, 4.9.182, 4.14.127, 4.19.52, 5.1.11, and is fixedin commits 967c05aee439e6e5d7d805e195b3a20ef5c433d6 and5f3e2bf008c2221478101ee72f5cb4654b9fc363.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2019-11479` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:
